it.escape.core.server.view.rmispecific

Class ServerRMICore

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.escape.core.server.view.rmispecific.ServerRMICore
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ServerRemoteInterface, java.rmi.Remote

    public class ServerRMICore
extends java.lang.Object
implements ServerRemoteInterface
    RMI server implementation. It exposes methods to be called by specific clients; a client will identify itself when calling such methods.
    Author:
    michele

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int REGISRTY_PORT 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void clientLost(MessagingChannelRMI channel) 
      MessagingChannelRMI findChannel(ClientRemoteInterface client)
      Finds the MessagingChannelRMI corresponding to a ClientRemote object
      static ServerRMICore getServerInstance(GlobalSettings locals) 
      void globalChat(java.lang.String message, ClientRemoteInterface client) 
      static void initializer(GlobalSettings locals)
      This method sets up the Registry and creates and exposes the ServerRMICore Remote Object; after the ServerRMICore class invoked this, the clients using RMI will be able to invoke functions.
      void pong(ClientRemoteInterface client) 
      void registerClient(ClientRemoteInterface client)
      Basically does the same things that Connection used to do upon establishing: 1)binds a MessagingChannel to the client connection(here, ClientRemoteInterface) 2)add a Client to the list of clients that use RMI 3)creates the appropriate UserMessagesReporter (UMR_RMI) 4)invokes: Master.newPlayerHasConnected(channel, locals); 5)sets up the Client as a subscriber of the appropriate Announcer(here, AnnouncerRMIBroadcast)
      void rename(java.lang.String message, ClientRemoteInterface client) 
      void setAnswer(java.lang.String answer, ClientRemoteInterface client) 
      void unregisterClient(ClientRemoteInterface client) 
      void whereAmI(ClientRemoteInterface client) 
      void whoAmI(ClientRemoteInterface client) 

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

        public void registerClient(ClientRemoteInterface client)
                    throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Basically does the same things that Connection used to do upon establishing: 1)binds a MessagingChannel to the client connection(here, ClientRemoteInterface) 2)add a Client to the list of clients that use RMI 3)creates the appropriate UserMessagesReporter (UMR_RMI) 4)invokes: Master.newPlayerHasConnected(channel, locals); 5)sets up the Client as a subscriber of the appropriate Announcer(here, AnnouncerRMIBroadcast)
        Specified by:

        Throws:

        public static void initializer(GlobalSettings locals)
